page.title: 02Rural depopulation
page.content: This area on the edge of the {Brendon Hills}is a very good example of how the{population}has declined in outlying country area during this century. At one time the{Mining Industry {and Slate Quarries}could support a thriving population. It is a very different story now. Apart from the fairly tight knit community lying alongside the Mineral Line, and occupying virtually the only land below 100 metres in height, the population in this block is now {sparse and widely scattered. There is now a great problem in earning a living in this area. There are virtually no services and access is by three very narrow minor roads. Many people now prefer to live in the larger concentrations of population on lower ground.
